column5: My once a year trip report!  After having a great time last August fishing Lake Erie with my son and guide Frank Dimarcantonio, my daughter thought she tag along this year as we ventured to Lake Seneca in the Finger Lakes region of New York.  Was only 3 1/2 hours from Toronto and an easy drive.  Started Friday Aug. 17th at 5:30 and went for lake trout initially as the small mouth were off all season. Weather was perfect which meant fish were off.  Did take in five nice lake trout though  Caitlin's first and personal best with Captain Don.    Only small mouth of day one...she's all smiles    Day two - last Saturday - was brutal.  Cold, windy and 2 - 3 foot waves.  Great for fishing!  Another six lakers right off the bat, then drifted for small mount.  26 caught that day in total.      Would definitely go back there again.  Nothing better than a great weekend with the kids.  Robert aka Kansas
Wow!  Fantastic report with lots of great fish and pics!  Thanks for sharing.
Great report, Robert. Ive never fished the Fingers. Thanks for sharing.
Nice hefty lakers you got there.
Lakers in Central New York, never would have thought of that.  Nice fish,  ehg

Right on great fishing trip !!!!!!!! you did very well on those lakers   as this time of year being thr hardest time to catch those finicky trout....nice pics of all your fish,including your daughter as she looks happy with that big laker thanks for sharing    cheers
Robert, did you happen to take a stroll thru watkins glen. Beautiful hike through the gorge there
Great report. Are you related to Jerry Springer?lol
